description.p: Asteria is a comprehensive astrological chart application that combines traditional astrology with modern AI technology.

ul.li: Calculate and display natal charts with precise planetary positions
Analyze aspects between planets with detailed interpretations
View planetary positions by house and sign
Examine element and modality distributions
Generate AI-powered chart interpretations for deeper insights
Calculate transit charts to see how current planetary positions affect your natal chart
Clean, intuitive interface for both beginners and experienced astrologers

description.p: Refinements and new features in AI interpretations, chart tagging, and Zodiac Sign predictions:

ul.li: All AI-generated markdown responses are transformed into rich HTML for beautifully formatted, clear, and engaging interpretations
Each chart type (Natal, Relationship, Progression, Return, Zodiac Signs) now has unique tags for accurate AI interpretation; exception: Composite charts are excluded
New Zodiac Sign Chart generates concise, magazine-style horoscopes for all 12 signs for a specified date and time
Multi-window support: open new windows from File → New Window in the same instance or a new instance
Drag-and-drop charts between windows with Ctrl + Left Mouse Button; all chart data loads in the target window's input or interpretation docks
View menu enhancements: toggle Chart-Only view and Info Overlay visibility; info overlay is hidden by default
Clear Interpretation button in the interpretation dock clears both displayed text and stored previous interpretations

description.p: For complete changelog and version history, see the Changelog under the Help menu in the application
Major release with significant new features and improvements:

ul.li: Redesigned chart rendering system: all elements now drawn anticlockwise
Added return charts for all major planets (Sun, Moon, Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, Pluto)
Secondary progression chart calculation and display
Calculate both lunar and solar eclipses
Transits calculation for up to 1 year, with advanced search and filtering dialog
Julian/Gregorian calendar toggle for pre-1582 dates
Chart type flag for each transit, used for more targeted AI interpretations
Allowed date span extended to 0001–3000 CE (BCE years excluded)
Export all chart data as text from the Chart Details tab
Added an Angles table displaying the values of ASC (Ascendant), DESC (Descendant), IC (Imum Coeli), and MC (Medium Coeli)
Added the SQQ (Sesquiquadrate, 135°) aspect to aspect calculations and filtering
Numerous minor UI polishes, bug fixes, and code improvements

description.p: For the complete changelog and version history, see the Changelog under the Help menu in the application.

ul.li: Changed degree display format from 0-360° decimal system to traditional in-sign degrees with minutes for improved astrological readability (e.g., 285.5° → 15°30' Capricorn)
House display now shows both formats for reference

description.p: For complete changelog and version history, please see Changelog under Help Menu in the application.

ul.li: Completely rebuilt the calculation engine: removed Python dependency and now using direct Swiss Ephemeris integration through native Qt/C++ code
Added an orb slider to set how many aspects are calculated and displayed
Added additional celestial bodies (Lilith, Ceres, Pallas, Juno, Vesta, Vertex, East Point, Part of Spirit)
Added a checkbox to toggle displaying additional bodies in the chart
Added Aspect Display Settings Dialog for customizing aspect appearance
Added relationship charts functionality with Composite and Davison charts
Preloaded OpenStreetMap QML at application startup for improved performance
Updated license to AGPL-3 to conform with Swiss Ephemeris requirements
Added OpenStreetMap dialog to assist users in easily searching and setting their birth location
Expanded retrograde planet depiction beyond the chart itself to include planet widgets, planet view, and aspects view
Made minor UI improvements for better usability

description.p: First stable release with the following features:

ul.li: Natal chart calculation and display
Aspect analysis
AI-powered interpretations
Transit calculations
